ontA.label: Cohort (Metadata)
ontA.comment: An ontological representation of the Cohort parameters. The ontology has been automatically generated based on the uploaded Excel Document with Cohort Metadata (extracted on Date: 2019-05-28). This document has been also automatically generated based on the data recorded about 395 patients. For each patient, there are 204 Fields (Parameters aka Properties), the value of which often come from one out of 101 different controlled Set of Terms. Metadata extracted have been revised by technical experts (in close collaboration with clinical experts).
ontA.creator: Institute of Communications and Computer Systems of National Technical University of Athens - ICCS/NTUA

ontB.label: HarmonicSS - Reference Model and Vocabularies
ontB.comment:
This ontology specifies the parameters of particular interest for the diagnosis, control and/or treatment of patients associated with the primary Sjogren Syndrome (pSS). 

The design of the ontology was driven by the documents with the minimum and maximum pSS parameters (D.4.1 revised) prepared by the Clinical Partners participating in the HarmonicSS project.

jsonarray.simcomments: The concepts have the same name. Strings "Female" and "Female" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "Male" and "Male" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "Active" and "Active " consist of the same main elements.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "Never smoker" and "Never Smoker" consist of the same sequence of characters.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "Anti-centromere" and "Anti-centromere" consist of the same sequence of characters.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "Anti-RNP" and "Anti-RNP" consist of the same sequence of characters.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "Anti-smooth muscle antibody" and "Anti-Smooth Muscle Antibody" consist of the same sequence of characters.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "Anti-thyroglobulin" and "Anti-thyroglobulin" consist of the same sequence of characters.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "Anti-TPO" and "anti-TPO" consist of the same sequence of characters.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "Rheumatoid factor" and "Rheumatoid factor" consist of the same sequence of characters.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "rheumatoid factors" and "Rheumatoid factor" consist of the same main elements.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "Rheumatoid factors" and "Rheumatoid factor" consist of the same main elements.

proparray.propertyname: EULAR Sjogren's Syndrome Patient Reported Index (ESSPRI) score

directTransformation.description: Provides the values of the parameters specified in the right side taking into account the patient data in the given fields as well as additional parameters provided. The value of the 1st Field should be an integer. For specifying whether the score was normal or not (Assessment), at least one of the two optional properties about UNL and/or DNL should be given.

Provides the values of the parameters specified in the right side taking into account the patient data in the given fields as well as additional parameters provided. The value of the 1st Field should be an integer. For specifying whether the score was normal or not (Assessment), at least one of the two optional properties about UNL and/or DNL should be given.

Provides the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Medical Condition) or not, taking into account the value of the given Field and the Mapping Rules specified (i.e., align Field Values with Confirmation Terms).

In case no Unit of Measurement specified in the Reference Model about the specific Lab Test, no data will be recorded.

proparray.propertyname: Kappa Free light chains (in Serum) (Normal: 3.3-19.4 mg/L)

directTransformation.description: Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome measured based on the Value of the given Field and the additional parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term and unit of measurement - both current and desirable). Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified, the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded, as well as whether the outcome was normal or not. In case no Unit of Measurement specified in the Reference Model about the specific Lab Test, no data will be recorded.
